intro: Brackenridgea bussei, commonly known as the Mexican brackenridgea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in warm climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally grown in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
